hi @lipxu  could you help to clarify what does the datastore lock for in the description? And why we could take it as a signal of mgmtd initial config done?

> hi @lipxu could you help to clarify what does the datastore lock for in the description? And why we could take it as a signal of mgmtd initial config done?

Thanks Storm, The datastore lock is used to prevent other processes from accessing the datastore while mgmtd is using it.
During startup, mgmtd acquires the datastore lock and releases it only after the initial configuration load is complete.
Therefore, if the script reports that the datastore is not locked, it is safe to assume that mgmtd has finished its initial configuration.

@liushilongbuaa , @saiarcot895 Can you please help review?
/azpw ms_conflict

> I see Mellanox platform has been updated, what about Broadcom, VS, and Marvell platforms?

@saiarcot895 as we cannot test it for their platform we cannot do that for other vendors.
@saiarcot895 , could you please approve if no more comments?

> @saiarcot895 , could you please approve if no more comments?

@saiarcot895 , can you please ?
@saiarcot895 Can you please review? Thanks

VS can absolutely be tested; it's just a VM running on a system with at least 6GB of free RAM and 2 cores that can be spared.

Additionally, because of the specificity of the command, I'd rather not see this diverge between different dockerfiles. This will just mean more maintenance work later when changes need to be made for whatever reason.
Actually, one improvement is to make this into a macro in `dockerfile-macros.j2` and use that macro in each Dockerfile.

> @venu-nexthop, any impact to number of macsec session which can be support if we set the mdb profile to L3-optimised

Thanks for the review @arlakshm ! I need to confirm with the macsec team. Let me get back on this.

> > @venu-nexthop, any impact to number of macsec session which can be support if we set the mdb profile to L3-optimised
> 
> Thanks for the review @arlakshm ! I need to confirm with the macsec team. Let me get back on this.

@arlakshm Looks like macsec does not consume any L2/L3 resources on ASIC. So should not have any impact because of this change.
